known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in the leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it will not be used. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll settings daily wage calculator takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists between leave policy and payroll modules for daily wage formula configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculator does not dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator lacks leap year recognition, potentially underpaying employee benefits.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: System vs Manual Gratuity Calculation Differences
known_issues.issue_explanation: Gratuity calculation shows slight differences between system (AED 231,821) and manual calculations (AED 252,485), with detailed breakdown revealing system uses specific service duration and daily wage formula
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor calculation variations in gratuity computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may not perfectly align with manual administrative expectations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Handling
known_issues.issue_explanation: System potentially miscalculates service duration by not consistently handling leap year days (February 29th) when computing total service days for gratuity calculation. The calculation method involves dividing total service days by 365, which can create minor discrepancies when leap years are involved.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled, causing potential minor calculation differences
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are precisely counted in service duration and gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses different calculation approaches for complete and incomplete years, including specific handling for leap years by using 366 as a divisor when applicable.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, potentially leading to misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Worked Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), and uses a fixed daily wage calculation method that may not match all client preferences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor discrepancy, with potential one-day variance in total days
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method lacks precision in tracking exact days worked

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths. User expected division by 31 calendar days, but system used 30-day divisor, resulting in slight salary calculation difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, with fixed daily rate divisor settings.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Report Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly leave salary accruals vary due to changing working days per month
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are configured after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Deduction Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor instead of calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific leave calculation methods. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-defined basic salary / working days method, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is currently based on a 26 working days per month standard (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments required for variations in employee working days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Deduction Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configurations are updated after leave requests are created

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365-day calculation for all years, failing to dynamically adjust for leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of service days and associated benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated salary calculations are consistently undercalculated by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2), affecting final settlements for employees leaving mid-month.
limitations.impact: Employees receive slightly less than the expected pro-rated amount during End of Service settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at end of month, preventing mid-month leave balance inclusion
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include partial month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting departure date as a working day and precise method of converting total service days to years of service
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations

limitations.title: Complex Partial Year Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculations use different methods for complete and partial years, with specific rules for counting days and applying different daily rates based on service duration milestones.
limitations.impact: Potential confusion in calculating end of service benefits, especially for employees with service periods crossing 5-year thresholds

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational needs

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows a fixed policy setting that may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot easily override the standard calculation method or adjust for month-specific variations

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculated on Working Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary accrual is based on the number of working days in a month, which varies monthly
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts will differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations between leave periods and regular payroll cycles

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations based on work week setup

limitations.title: Salary Proration Date Sensitivity Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Leave Transaction Deletion Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

limitations.title: No Retroactive Deduction Recalculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate salary deductions retroactively after initial calculation, even when configuration changes occur.
limitations.impact: Manual adjustments may be required when timing of public holiday additions affects leave calculations

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month expectations

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use calendar days, which means the daily rate varies based on the actual number of days in each month (e.g., 29 days in February during a leap year).
limitations.impact: Unpaid leave deductions are prorated based on the exact number of calendar days in the month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
